intro: Oreopanax anomalus, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a climbing plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with long, slender leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by orange-red berries that are edible. Its botanical features include a woody stem, aerial roots, and a preference for humid, shaded environments. Oreopanax anomalus is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
